trans-unit.source: Contains information about a part of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> at a specified coordinate.

The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo> class, in conjunction with the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner.HitTest%2A> method of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> is used to determine which part of an <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> the user has clicked.
The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo> class contains the location and associated designer that was clicked.
Initializes an instance of a <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo"></xref> object.
The associated <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref>.
The location on the associated <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> that was clicked.
Gets the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> associated with the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo"></xref> class.

The <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo.AssociatedDesigner%2A> property stores a reference to the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> associated with the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo> object.

Use the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner> to reference extended information about the designer associated with the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo>.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> associated with the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo"></xref> class.
Returns the bounds of the area hit.
The bounds will describe the area on the screen that was hit, usually the area that encloses the associated <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner>.

A rectangle that encloses the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ActivityDesigner"></xref> associated with the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo"></xref> object or an empty rectangle if the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo"></xref> object is not associated with a designer.
Contains information about where the hit occurred.
Use the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo.HitLocation%2A> to determine on what area of the designer the hit occurred.
A <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestLocations"></xref> that describes the area hit.
Returns the index of the hit designer.
Use the value returned by <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo.MapToIndex%2A> to determine which designer was hit.
This is useful for insertion or deletion operations.
The index of the designer hit by the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo"></xref>.
Gets an empty <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo"></xref>.
Use `Nowhere` to get an empty <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo>.
An empty <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo"></xref>.
Gets a selectable object associated with the hit area.
Use `SelectableObject` to get the selectable object associated with the hit area.

If a designer is associated with the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo>, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo.SelectableObject%2A> will return the activity associated with the designer, or null reference (`Nothing`) if no designer is associated with the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo>.

A selectable object associated with the hit area or a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) if no designer is associated with the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo"></xref>.
Gets the user data associated with the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo"></xref>.
Use <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo.UserData%2A> to store user information about the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo>.
If no user data has been stored, calling <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo.UserData%2A> creates a new, empty dictionary for use.
A new dictionary for user data, or a reference to the existing user data.
